message.content: This question requires a basic understanding of the concepts of light and visibility. The man with a candle and match would see better through an underground tunnel because the light from the candle would provide illumination in the dark tunnel, allowing him to see his surroundings. The options (A), (B), and (C) are not relevant because a pen, stick, or spoon would not provide any source of light.

To answer this question, we need to consider the source of light in an underground tunnel. Option (A), (B), and (C) are all objects that do not produce light, so they would not be able to see well in a dark underground tunnel. Option (D), a man with a candle and match, would have the advantage in this scenario. By lighting the candle with the match, the man would have a portable and continuous source of light, allowing him to see better in the darkness of the tunnel.

This question requires an understanding of light and how it travels. In an underground tunnel, there is no natural source of light, so we need to provide our own source of light in order to see. Option (D) is the correct answer because a man with a candle and match would be able to create a small flame, which would emit light and allow him to see in the darkness of the tunnel. Option (A) is incorrect because a pen does not emit light. Option (B) is incorrect because a stick does not emit light. Option (C) is incorrect because a spoon does not emit light.
